author: @NECN
title: Healey: Trooper's ‘terrible' behavior in Karen Read case harms law enforcement
text:
The testimony this week of a lead State Police investigator in the Karen Read murder case was “terrible” and tarnishes the integrity of law enforcement, Gov. Maura Healey said Thursday while also declining to weigh in further on the closely-watched trial.
Read is accused of backing her car into her Boston police officer boyfriend, John O’Keefe, and leaving him to die outside a Canton home in January 2022. Her attorneys contend she is being framed as part of a larger cover-up and the trial has attracted the attention of the media and internet sleuths from around the world.
Trooper Michael Proctor was a lead investigator on the case and took the stand in Dedham District Court this week. During cross-examination, Read’s attorneys had Proctor read aloud text messages he sent to other troopers and friends disparaging Read , commenting on her physical appearance using vulgar language, suggesting he had made up his mind based on evidence as to Read’s guilt, and saying he wished Read would kill herself.
“It’s terrible … it’s completely unprofessional. It does harm, frankly, to the dignity and the integrity of the work of men and women across the State Police and law enforcement. So as a former attorney general and as governor, I am disgusted by that,” Healey told reporters Thursday afternoon when asked about Proctor’s texts.
Watch the Karen Read trial live on nbcboston.com, NECN, NBC Boston streaming platforms (including Roku, Peacock and Samsung TV) and NBC10 Boston’s YouTube page . Every night of the trial at 7 p.m., come back for analysis and more.
Email questions to canton.confidential@nbcuni.com . Proctor, who is based in Norfolk District Attorney Michael Morrissey’s office, is also designated as the lead officer on the Brian Walshe murder case, which involves allegations that Walshe murdered and dismembered his wife in their Cohasset home in early 2023. NBC10 Boston reported this week that legal experts think Proctor’s testimony in the Read case could undermine cases he has been involved with.
Healey took only one question from reporters on the Read trial Thursday and said she could not say any more.
“This is the subject of a criminal investigation and trial, and therefore it’s not appropriate for me to speak more to that at this time,” she said.
More on the Karen Read trial
Karen Read 10 hours ago DNA experts follow state police supervisor in Karen Read trial Massachusetts State Police 8 hours ago Brian Walshe lawyer to file motion naming investigator Proctor after Read trial testimony Karen Read May 20 Catch up on the Karen Read trial: Watch every day of court

author: 大成報
title: 大學申請入學放榜! 新北1,105名學子錄取國立大學再創佳績
text:
大學申請入學放榜! 新北1,105名學子錄取國立大學再創佳績
(大成報記者張玉玲/新北報導)114學年度大學申請入學今(12)日放榜，新北巿公私立高中職今年報名人數總計8,519人，錄取5,097人，其中計有1,105人錄取國立大學，錄取臺灣大學43人、清華大學48人、陽明交通大學30人、政治大學48人、成功大學28人、臺灣師範大學61人、中央大學46人、中興大學45人、中正大學40人，以及中山大學25人，新北學子表現亮眼。
北大高中語文實驗班秦蔓綺同學錄取國立臺灣大學外國語文學系。國中畢業於三峽國中，展現優異語文表達能力，屢次擔任校內外英文司儀，並積極參與模擬聯合國、國際週及專題策展等活動，展現領導力與國際溝通素養。在北大高中學習期間聚焦語言與國際素養的紮實學習，特別勉勵學弟妹不要因為小小挫折就輕言放棄，所有歷程都是最好的安排。
圖說：北大高中秦蔓綺國立臺灣大學外國語文學系。
丹鳳高中國中部直升語文實驗班的彭慈雯同學，以優異表現錄取國立政治大學政星招生。慈雯自小由父親與奶奶扶養成長，面對家庭經濟壓力，高中三年未參加補習班，全憑學校提供之學習資源努力不懈，展現堅韌毅力與自學能力。在學期間積極參與司法院參訪、人權園區探索、微電影創作、新詩寫作與圖書館國際交流等活動，不僅培養人文素養與批判思維，更展現出色的跨文化溝通能力。慈雯也期許未來能投身公共事務，改善社會福利制度，造福更多家庭，勉勵學弟妹要不斷持續充實，勇敢迎接未知挑戰。
圖說：丹鳳高中彭慈雯(右2)錄取國立政治大學政星招生。
明德高中體育班林泯諭同學錄取國立臺灣師大體育與運動科學系，展現的典範。國中就讀中正國中時兼顧學業與田徑訓練，高中選擇進入體育班，面對高強度訓練與嚴格課業雙重挑戰，始終堅持不懈。泯諭善用通勤與課餘時間積極複習，成績長期維持班排前三名；同時在全國性賽事中屢次名列前茅，展現堅強意志與自律精神。他也鼓勵學弟妹，時間管理與堅持不懈是兼顧學業與運動的關鍵。
圖說：明德高中林泯諭錄取國立臺灣師大體育與運動科學系。
教育局強調，新北市持續推動在地就學，自110年起迄今已與超過30所頂尖大學合作，開設超過200門假日專班微課程、營隊，讓學生可以完整探索大學18學群並進行生涯定向；111學年度起更透過「高級中等學校在地就學大聯盟計畫」結合雙語國際、資訊科學、法政商管等重點發展特色的校訂課程，並與大學合作向上鏈結資源，進行共備跨校、跨學制及跨領域的策略合作，引領高中生順利銜接大學升學進路。
另，新北市自108年開始推動雙聯學制，112年起由教育局統籌辦理簽約，至今已與英國、美國、加拿大、日本、紐西蘭等國完成簽署14項雙聯學制及國際合作備忘錄，開放全市高中職皆可參加。此外，首創獎助學金鼓勵公立學校學生參加雙聯學制，每生每年最高補助5萬元，至多補助3年，最高總計15萬元。未來將持續鏈結更多跨國跨校資源，提升學生升學優勢，讓申請雙聯學制的新北學子展現亮眼成績。
教育局提醒，大學分科測驗將於114年7月11日至7月12日辦理，報名作業自6月5日起至6月17日，準備參加分科測驗的考生，記得把握報名時間。新北市未來將持續推動各式計畫協助在地就學學生學習專業知能，並運用到未來職涯、成就夢想。
(圖/教育局提供)

author: Jana Ruark
title: Delaware Flags Ordered to Half-Staff to Honor Robert Voshell | | wboc.com
text:
DELAWARE- Delaware Governor John Carney has ordered the flags to be lowered to half-staff to honor Korean War Veteran and former Senate Majority Leader Robert Voshell on the day of his internment.
The flags are planned to be lowered at all state facilities through sunset on Saturday, March 9. According to the Rogers-Hovatter Funeral Home, Voshell passed away on March 1 after a "long illness."
Voshell is a lifelong public servant, starting in high school when he was selected as a member of the Boys State in 1950 and 1951. He spent his career at the Division of Motor Vehicles, retiring as director after 40 years of state government service.
He donated his time and talents to a number of community groups, including Bayhealth, People’s Place, Carlisle and Houston Fire Companies, American Legion Post 3 and Delaware Safety Council. He was an active member of Avenue United Methodist Church.
“Bob was a true public servant who loved his family and his community,” said Governor Carney. “He always put the needs of his constituents and the community first. He was a real gentleman and a strong leader who was a pleasure to work with. Tracey and I were saddened to learn of his passing. We will keep his family and friends in our prayers.”

author: Paula Castro
title: Nueva modalidad de estafa: Si recibe llamadas de este número desconocido tenga cuidado
text: [Paula Castro](https://www.colombia.com/staff/128/paula-castro)• Colombia.com Nueva modalidad de estafa: Si recibe llamadas de este número desconocido tenga cuidado Esta nueva modalidad de robo está en furor, evite contestar las llamadas con este indicativo. Esta nueva modalidad de robo está en furor, evite contestar las llamadas con este indicativo. Muchas personas han reportado a través de redes sociales que están recibiendo llamadas entrantes en su número personal y en su WhatsApp, pero no son llamadas comunes, son de números con indicativos de otros países o teléfonos extraños, muchas veces al responder contestan que se trata del banco para actualizar datos o información, pero, es probable que se trate de una nueva modalidad de robo. Y es que ahora los delincuentes están aprovechando nuevas herramientas tecnológicas y han encontrado la manera de llamar desde lo que parece ser números extranjeros, escondiendo así las posibilidades de rastreo de los responsables del robo, según las denuncias las llamadas tienen el indicativo +84, qué correspondiente a Vietnam. Al parecer, valiéndose de la popularidad de WhatsApp, los estafadores han tratado de robar información personal y financiera de sus víctimas, a través de llamadas telefónicas, mensajes de texto y ofertas fraudulentas para engañar a las personas. Tras hacer las llamadas estas personas inescrupulosas logran incluso obtener datos como contraseñas y claves de seguridad de las cuentas bancarias, los delincuentes tratan, por ejemplo, de obtener información personal, tomar capturas de pantalla de los rostros de las personas para luego suplantarlas o robar datos financieros para realizar compras o cargos sin autorización. El fraude comienza cuando los delincuentes acceden de manera remota a los dispositivos móviles de las personas. Una vez que logran esto, roban las credenciales bancarias para acceder al homebanking y vaciar las cuentas de ahorros de las víctimas. Mediante diversas técnicas de ingeniería social, los criminales engañan a sus posibles víctimas haciéndose pasar por empleados de empresas de servicio eléctrico. Utilizan falsos avisos de deuda, enlaces maliciosos para acceder a subsidios, y ofertas de descuentos inexistentes para jubilados. De esta manera, logran convencer a las personas desprevenidas para que les proporcionen información sensible. Es por eso que se comienza a advertir a las personas para que no respondan este tipo de llamadas y ninguna de números extraños o que puedan tener indicativos de otros países, incluso se recomienda que puedan bloquear estos números en el celular y en WhatsApp y ajuste la configuración de privacidad en sus aplicaciones para limitar las interacciones con desconocidos.

author: Roman Perkowski
title: Shield AI’s Funding Surge Fuels Advancement in Autonomous Defense Technology
text:
Shield AI’s Funding Surge Fuels Advancement in Autonomous Defense Technology
In a significant boost to its financial resources, Shield AI, a pioneer in defense technology, has successfully increased its Series F funding round by an impressive $300 million. The latest influx has escalated the company’s total funding to a staggering $500 million. The increased valuation of the tech startup now reaches $2.8 billion, marking a slight increase from the previous $2.7 billion.
Venture debt, typically viewed with skepticism, has proven advantageous for Shield AI as the $200 million component of the funding comes from debt financing by Hercules Capital. The company has tactfully balanced equity and debt to propel its late-stage growth without diluting its capital structure too aggressively.
Shield AI’s ambitious project involves the development of an AI pilot system, with its Hivemind technology at the forefront. This innovation aims to transform conventional aircraft into sophisticated autonomous systems capable of operating without human intervention, even in the absence of GPS or remote communications. The recent advances in artificial intelligence and computing have been the catalyst for this significant development, showcasing a pivotal shift in aerial and defense capabilities.
Recently, the company unveiled V-BAT Teams, an advanced software allowing coordinated autonomous operation of teams of V-BAT drones. This progression underlines Shield AI’s strategic approach towards modern warfare where agility and technological supremacy are paramount.
The importance of integrating AI piloting systems into national defense strategies was further highlighted by the firm’s president and co-founder in a Senate hearing. He described the integration as challenging, advocating for swift and decisive adoption of AI technologies to maintain military superiority in a rapidly evolving landscape of warfare.
In summary, Shield AI’s latest financial achievement fuels its mission to innovate within the aerospace and defense sector, emphasizing the urgency for a paradigm shift towards AI-driven military assets for future deterrence and operational efficiency.
FAQ Section:
1. What is Shield AI?
Shield AI is a defense technology company that specializes in creating artificial intelligence systems, such as the Hivemind technology, that can enable aircraft and other systems to operate autonomously without human intervention.
2. How much has Shield AI raised in their Series F funding round?
Shield AI has raised an additional $300 million in its Series F funding round, bringing the company’s total funding to $500 million.
3. What is the current valuation of Shield AI?
After the latest funding, Shield AI’s valuation has climbed to $2.8 billion.
4. What is venture debt and how did Shield AI utilize it?
Venture debt is a type of debt financing provided to venture-backed companies. It was used by Shield AI to acquire $200 million of its Series F funding from Hercules Capital, allowing the company to grow without significantly diluting its capital structure.
5. Can you tell me more about Shield AI’s Hivemind technology?
Shield AI’s Hivemind technology is an AI pilot system that aims to convert traditional aircraft into autonomous systems that can operate independently of GPS or remote communications.
6. What are V-BAT drones?
V-BAT drones are a type of autonomous aircraft developed by Shield AI. The company recently introduced V-BAT Teams, an advanced software for coordinating autonomous operations of these drones.
7. Why is Shield AI focusing on AI-driven military assets?
The company believes AI-driven military assets are crucial for maintaining military superiority and ensuring operational efficiency in modern warfare, which is undergoing rapid transformation due to advancements in technology.
Definitions:
– AI (Artificial Intelligence): A field of computer science focused on creating machines capable of performing tasks that typically require human intelligence, such as decision-making, visual perception, speech recognition, and language translation.
– Autonomous Systems: Machines or systems that can perform tasks and make decisions without human input.
– GPS (Global Positioning System): A satellite-based navigation system that allows users to determine their exact location on Earth.
– Debt Financing: The process of raising capital through borrowing, which may include taking loans or issuing bonds.
– Capital Structure: The way a corporation finances its assets through combinations of equity, debt, or hybrid securities.
Related Links:
–
Shield AI
–
Hercules Capital
Roman Perkowski is a distinguished name in the field of space exploration technology, specifically known for his work on propulsion systems for interplanetary travel. His innovative research and designs have been crucial in advancing the efficiency and reliability of spacecraft engines. Perkowski’s contributions are particularly significant in the development of sustainable and powerful propulsion methods, which are vital for long-duration space missions. His work not only pushes the boundaries of current space travel capabilities but also inspires future generations of scientists and engineers in the quest to explore the far reaches of our solar system and beyond.

author: Listin Diario
title: Asciende seguridad del Metro que devolvió 517 mil pesos encontrados en vagón
text: Asciende seguridad del Metro que devolvió 517 mil pesos encontrados en vagón El ahora cabo fue reconocido por su “honestidad e integridad” con la imposición de una nueva insignia El raso del Ejército, Maicol Antonio Céspedes, quien presta servicio en el Cuerpo Especializado para la Seguridad del Metro y Teleférico (Cesmet), fue ascendido a cabo como recompensa por haber devuelto a su dueña 517 mil pesos que encontró en un vagón de la estación del Metro de Santo Domingo, Manuel Arturo Peña Batlle. En un acto encabezado por el ministro de Defensa, Carlos Díaz Morfa, el ahora cabo fue reconocido por su “honestidad e integridad” con la imposición de una nueva insignia que, según indicaron, “resalta el valor de la integridad en el servicio militar y es muestra de ejemplo para todos los integrantes de las fuerzas castrenses, de que el trabajo en excelencia es premiado”. Según reporta el Ministerio de Defensa, suscribiéndose a lo que en primer instancia había informado la Oficina Para el Reordenamiento de Transporte (Opret), ante el hecho, que ocurrió el pasado 15 de enero, Céspedes reportó y devolvió el dinero a su legítima dueña, siguiendo los procedimientos establecidos. “Demostró el alto nivel de responsabilidad y dedicación de los militares dominicanos en su labor de proteger y servir a la ciudadanía”, afirmaron. El soldado estuvo acompañado por el director del CESMET, mayor general Manuel Antonio Lachapelle De los Santos.

author: TomAdams71
title: Leroy Sané lauds team-first attitude after leading Bayern Munich to 5-0 win over Hoffenheim
text:
Bayern Munich followed up their tricky 1-0 win over Borussia Mönchengladbach with an absolute routing of Hoffenheim at the Allianz Arena, winning by five goals to nil. A brace from Leroy Sané led the charge for the Rekordmeister and the other three goals were provided by Harry Kane (penalty), Raphaël Guerreiro, and Serge Gnabry.
It was exactly what the doctor order for Vincent Kompany, especially after Bayer Leverkusen had once again reduced Bayern’s gap at the top of the Bundesliga table to just one point with their 1-0 win over Mainz just one day prior to Bayern’s demolition of Hoffenheim. The gap is now back to four points.
After receiving a fair amount of criticism for missing the open goal attempt in the second half of the draw at Gladbach, Leroy Sané looked like his old self against Hoffenheim and was well-deserving of the pair of goals he scored. He can often times really be a confidence-type player, but against Hoffenheim he was certainly on the right end of that scale after looking a bit short of it over the weekend.
Despite his standout performance, the winger attributed the three points to the overall team performance, taking attention away from his own exploits during proceedings before he was subbed off in the 67th minute for Michael Olise. “The most important thing for me is to help the team. We have to keep it up. The first half of the season is now done, we’re having fun on the pitch - I think the fans can see that. We know what our strengths are and we have to keep showing them on the pitch,” the winger explained after the final whistle had blown (via @iMiaSanMia).
Personally for Sané, he has now tallied seven goals and one assist from his 21 appearances across all competitions, which, for his standards by this stage, is nothing special, but he was returning from an ongoing pubic bone injury that required surgery after the EUROs with Germany this past summer. It has taken him a while to hit form, but consistency will be the key for him and what Kompany will be hoping for. If Sané can continue to perform like he did in the Hoffenheim win, he will certainly be giving Kompany difficult selection decisions in attack with his starting lineups.
Looking for more commentary and analysis of Bayern Munich’s 5-0 bashing of Hoffenheim? Awesome, then check out our Bavarian Podcast Works — Postgame Show on Patreon, Spotify, or below:
Be sure to stay tuned to Bavarian Podcast Works for all of your up to date coverage on Bayern Munich and Germany. Check us out on Patreon and follow us on Twitter @BavarianFBWorks, @BavarianPodcast @TheBarrelBlog, @BFWCyler, @IredahlMarcus, @2012nonexistent, @TommyAdams71 and more.

author: Kaitlyn Rosati
title: This Overlooked, Budget-Friendly Destination Is Perfect To Escape The Harsh Winter
text: This Overlooked, Budget-Friendly Destination Is Perfect To Escape The Harsh Winter It's awfully chilly out there these days, and if you hate the cold as much as the next person, we reckon it's time to head out into the sunshine. If you determine you're too broke to travel after splurging on the holidays, think again. There's one sunny destination that [won't break the bank](https://www.explore.com/1472585/best-times-year-travel-2024/) and is a short jaunt from mainland USA. Nicaragua, located in Central America, is a historic, vibrant nation full of delicious eats, colonial architecture, dramatic volcanoes, and relaxing beaches. With warm weather year-round, it's a perfect escape from the tundras of winter. Perhaps best of all, Nicaragua is notoriously one of the most affordable destinations for American travelers. If you're looking to head off the beaten path to a destination that doesn't require a flight to the other ends of the earth to get a quick fix of sunshine, it's time to start planning your winter escape to Nicaragua. Cost of an average trip So, just how affordable is Nicaragua? When it comes to accommodation, centrally located high-rated hotels are available in Granada for as low as $14/night, like [Selina Granada](https://www.selina.com/nicaragua/granada/). In the capital of Managua, you can snag a five-star hotel, such as [Hilton Princess Managua](https://www.hilton.com/en/hotels/mgahfhf-hilton-princess-managua/?SEO_id=GMB-AMER-HF-MGAHFHF&y_source=1_MTIxNjk1NDUtNzE1LWxvY2F0aW9uLndlYnNpdGU%3D), typically for less than $100/night. Note that prices are subject to fluctuation due to availability and season. Average meals in Nicaragua certainly won't break the bank. Travelers in the past have reported that the average cost of daily meals, in total, is about $15. For some of the best bites, try gallo pinto, quesillo, Indio viejo, and nacatamale. While renting a car is affordable in Nicaragua, there are a few things to consider beforehand. For starters, there are several police checkpoints throughout the country, and driving can also be challenging in rural areas of the country. If you choose to rent a car, you will need an international driver's license and a driver's license from your home country. Rental cars from Managua start around $14/day. If you want to forfeit the car, transportation is readily available via intercity busses, which only cost between $1 and $4 for shorter routes and up to $20 for longer rides. Since Nicaragua is so affordable, you might want to consider a private taxi, but make sure to set a price before getting into the car, and don't be afraid to negotiate the price if you feel you're getting ripped off. Destinations worth visiting Nicaragua is geographically small and can be seen in just a few days. If you enjoy slow travel, this country is an ideal destination for spending a few weeks, especially for those who work remotely, due to its affordable cost of living. Granada is one city you definitely won't want to miss while visiting the country. It is home to the Catedral de Granada, a stunning church that dates back to 1583. You'll want to ensure you stroll through Central Parque, where you can purchase goods from local vendors while taking in the colonial-style architecture of the city. Granada is also home to the [ChocoMuseo](https://www.chocomuseo.com/), or Chocolate Museum of Granada. Not only can you taste some Nicaraguan chocolate, but you can take cooking classes, as well. For a truly underrated destination, head to the picturesque remote [Corn Islands](https://www.explore.com/1402944/visit-underrated-corn-islands-caribbean-laidback-tropical-vacation/). Located off mainland Nicaragua, the Corn Islands are a hidden gem in Nicaragua and the Caribbean. They're especially great for those who want to kick back, relax, and enjoy that slow island life. León is yet another fascinating Nicaraguan city that should not be skipped. It is conveniently located near Cerro Negro, a volcano that's great for hiking, sandboarding, and viewing. With so much to do, one of the best ways to see León quickly and learn about its historical context is by taking a [free walking tour of the city](https://www.guruwalk.com/p829-leon).
